bibl.title: Letter from Harvey E. Jordan to Philip Showalter Hench, September 26, 1940

div1.p: Jordan informs Hench of the arrangements for a University of Virginia dinner in Moran's honor.

div1.head: Letter from Harvey E. Jordan to Philip Showalter Hench, September 26, 1940
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
DEPARTMENT OF MEDICINE
CHARLOTTESVILLE
September 26, 1940
OFFICE OF THE DEAN
Dr. P. S. Hench
The Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Please accept my best thanks for your
letter of September 19th with reference to Mr.
Moran's visit to the University of Virginia on
October 24th. Our earlier information was to the
effect that Mr. Moran planned to be here on
October 25th. We had a reply to our invitation
from Mr. Moran stating that it was doubtful whether
he could make arrangements for the trip North in
October. I wrote saying that we hoped that the
arrangements could still be made and that we would
plan for the dinner in his honor as soon as we
heard from him definitely after October 15th for
any date that might fit in with his plans at
Washington and Jefferson College. I am glad to
learn from the copy of your letter to Mr. Moran
dated September 19th that Mr. Pew is making it
possible for Mr. Moran to take this trip. As soon
as I hear definitely from Mr. Moran I shall write
again to General Kean specifying the exact date
for the dinner and makeing the final arrangements.
We shall invite to this dinner as our guests also
President Newcomb, Mr. Clemons, your brother and
Dr. Cooke of Lexington. If you could possibly
arrange to be with us at that time, we should like
very much to have you also as our guest.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, H. E. Jordan, Dean. HEJ/MHL
